skill.name: dev-tools-skill
skill.description: Use when the user says "use the DevTools skill" or when they need help debugging a web app with Chrome DevTools MCP (UI bugs, incorrect behavior, console errors, network/API failures, or performance/lag), especially if the user seems inexperienced and needs guided, step-by-step diagnosis.
skill.summary: Use when the user says "use the DevTools skill" or when they need help debugging a web app with Chro...
skill.author: Eccentric-jamaican

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown guidance for Chrome DevTools MCP. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. All static findings are false positives: YAML field names and JSON hash strings misidentified as cryptographic algorithms; markdown backticks for tool names misidentified as shell execution. This is pure documentation.

content.user_title: Debug web apps with Chrome DevTools MCP
content.value_statement: Frontend bugs are hard to diagnose without the right tools. This skill provides guided workflows to identify and fix UI issues, performance problems, network errors, and console failures using Chrome DevTools MCP.
actual_capabilities: Diagnose UI and layout issues using DOM snapshot inspection
Identify performance bottlenecks via tracing and CWV insights
Debug network and API failures with request inspection
Read and analyze console errors and stack traces
Guide users through step-by-step bug diagnosis
limitations: Requires Chrome DevTools MCP server to be running
Cannot modify production code without explicit user approval
Limited to browser-accessible pages and resources
Cannot debug native mobile apps or desktop applications

use_cases.title: Debug layout and UI bugs
use_cases.description: Quickly identify why elements are hidden, misaligned, or not responding to interactions.

use_cases.title: Fix API and network errors
use_cases.description: Diagnose failed requests, CORS issues, and data loading problems in web apps.

use_cases.title: Profile page performance
use_cases.description: Trace slow loads, janky animations, and long tasks to recommend optimizations.

prompt_templates.title: Quick UI check
prompt_templates.prompt: The page layout looks broken. Use the DevTools skill to take a snapshot, find the affected elements, and identify the likely cause.

prompt_templates.title: Performance scan
prompt_templates.prompt: This page is slow to load. Use the DevTools skill to run a performance trace and find the main bottlenecks.

prompt_templates.title: API debugging
prompt_templates.prompt: The data is not loading correctly. Use the DevTools skill to check network requests and console for errors.

prompt_templates.title: Console errors
prompt_templates.prompt: There is a JavaScript error on this page. Use the DevTools skill to read the full error and trace it to the source.

output_examples.input: The login button is not working on the checkout page
output: 1. Snapshot shows login button exists but is covered by an overlay
2. The overlay has z-index: 9999 and pointer-events: none
3. The button is technically visible but not clickable
4. Fix: Adjust button z-index or remove blocking overlay
5. Risk level: Low - CSS-only change, easy to rollback

output_examples.input: The dashboard takes 5 seconds to load
output: 1. Performance trace shows LCP at 4.8 seconds
2. Main bottleneck: Large bundle (2.3MB) blocking main thread
4. Recommendations: Code-split bundle, lazy-load images, defer non-critical JS

output_examples.input: API calls are failing with CORS errors
output: 1. Network shows 3 failed requests to /api/data endpoint
3. Console shows: 'Blocked by CORS policy' errors
4. Fix needed: Add CORS headers to backend server configuration

best_practices: Always take a snapshot first to capture the current DOM state before making changes
Propose the smallest possible fix first and validate before trying larger changes
Confirm destructive actions like form submissions with the user before proceeding
anti_patterns: Running performance traces on production pages during peak traffic
Submitting forms or making API calls without explicit user approval
Making large refactoring changes instead of minimal targeted fixes

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: This skill requires the Chrome DevTools MCP server to be running and connected to your browser.

faq.question: Can this skill fix backend API issues?
faq.answer: No, it can only diagnose API issues from the browser side by inspecting network requests.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: It can suggest code changes but will ask for your approval before making any modifications.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, all analysis happens locally in your browser. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why is the snapshot different from the visual page?
faq.answer: The accessibility tree may differ from visual rendering. Use screenshots for visual confirmation when needed.

faq.question: How is this different from manual DevTools use?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured workflows and guides you through diagnosis step by step with best practices.
